name: fileorganizer
description: Use your custom-defined templates to rename your scene files.

arguments.name: dry
arguments.description: Whether to perform the rename operation or just a simulation.

arguments.name: fileStructureTemplate
arguments.description: The template for the new name. See documentation above for details.

arguments.name: normalizeAccents
arguments.description: Whether to normalize file names and path to unaccented unicode.

arguments.name: normalizeMultipleSpaces
arguments.description: Whether to replace multiple spaces with a single space.

arguments.name: nameConflictHandling
arguments.description: Behavior in case of name conflicts. Possible values are: `rename` and `skip`. With `rename`, the new filename is suffixed with a number so that it does not conflict with an existing name anymore. With `skip`, the rename operation is cancelled.

arguments.name: dateFormat
arguments.description: The date format to use in file names. The full details are available at https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/ although you probably just need `YYYY`, `MM` and `DD`.

arguments.name: multiValuesSeparator
arguments.description: The separator to use for multiple values (like actors, labels,...). For instance, with a `', '` as separator, a list of 3 labels will look like: `label1, label2, label3`.

arguments.name: characterReplacement
arguments.description: Used to substitite characters with a replacement alternative. See doc above for details. Note: the examples below looks like it is replacing a colon by a colon, but it is actually replacing the colon (illegal in filenames) by the similar looking 'mathematical ratio' character (allowed in filenams)
